text:
41-45 East 49th Street, north side, between Madison and Park Avenues.
About 1911.

Madison Avenue, west side, between 49th and 50th Streets, the rear of 438, 440, 442 and 444 Madison Avenue, buildings demolished in 1930.

Wurts Brothers


May 6, 1915

446-450 Madison Avenue, west side, between 50th and 49th Streets
Wurts Brothers
May 6, 1915

(1)
49th Street, south side, west from Madison Avenue.
April 4, 1932.

(2)

handwritten:
To Be Seen 17, 12-14 East. NY Sun 9/20/38 [???]

Madison Avenue at N.E. corner of 49th Street, showing Hotel New Weston, with Columbia College tablet on wall. On N.W. corner is lot shown vacant in preparation for erection of 444 Madison Avenue building in the following year.

September 28, 1930.

P.L. Sperr, Photographer.

Madison Avenue, east side of block between 49th and 50th Streets. Excavation in foreground is site of 444 Madison Avenue building,
1931.
September 28, 1930.
P.L. Sperr, Photographer.
NO REPRODUCTIONS. neg # 639

(2)
Madison Avenue, east side, between 49th and 50th Streets, seen across excavation where 444 now stands. Includes Hotel New Weston, old building on right (49th Street) and new building
(50th Street) on left, just completed.
September 28, 1930.
P.L. Sperr, Photographer.
NO REPRODUCTIONS. neg #640

Madison Avenue, east side of block between 49th and 50th Streets. Excavation in foreground is site of 444 Madison Avenue building,
1931.
September 28, 1930.
P.L. Sperr, Photographer.
NO REPRODUCTIONS. neg # 639

(2)
Madison Avenue, east side, between 49th and 50th Streets, seen across excavation where 444 now stands. Includes Hotel New Weston, old building on right (49th Street) and new building
(50th Street) on left, just completed.
September 28, 1930.
P.L. Sperr, Photographer.
NO REPRODUCTIONS. neg #640

(1)
Madison Avenue, south from 50th Street, showing block of small buildings on west side, 50th to 49th Streets which were demolished the following year, and the old building on S. E. corner of 50th Street, which was demolished late in 1929 to make room for the new building of Hotel New Weston.                          July 1929.

P.L. Sperr, Photographer.

(2)
Madison Avenue, west side, looking south from 50th Street. Block of low houses in foreground, between 50th and 49th Street, was
demolished in 1930.
Conspicuous in background is the Lincoln Building.
Just visible in the extreme background is the top of the Metropolitan
Life Building tower.

March 4, 1930.

P.L. Sperr, Photographer.

(1)
Madison Avenue, south from 50th Street, showing block of small buildings on west side, 50th to 49th Streets which were demolished the following year, and the old building on S. E. corner of 50th Street, which was demolished late in 1929 to make room for the new building of Hotel New Weston.                          July 1929.

P.L. Sperr, Photographer.

(2)
Madison Avenue, west side, looking south from 50th Street. Block of low houses in foreground, between 50th and 49th Street, was
demolished in 1930.
Conspicuous in background is the Lincoln Building.
Just visible in the extreme background is the top of the Metropolitan
Life Building tower.

March 4, 1930.

P.L. Sperr, Photographer.

(1)

444 Madison Avenue, west side, from 49th to 50th Streets, showing rear view of building.
The camera is pointed in a northeasterly direction.
In both views the Hell Gate Bridge is dimly seen on the horizon.
The body and tower of the building have been completed.
In the right center background is the R.C.A. tower on the west side of Lexington Avenue between 50th and 51st Streets.
The Queensboro Bridge may be seen between these buildings.
July 11, 1931.

P.L. Sperr, Photographer.

(2)

The same, a slightly closer view, not showing the R.C.A. tower and showing on the left, the tower of the 42-story Inter-national Mart, on the N.E. corner of Madison Avenue and 53rd Street, nearing completion.

July 11, 1931.

P.L. Sperr, Photographer.

(1)

444 Madison Avenue, west side, from 49th to 50th Streets, showing rear view of building.
The camera is pointed in a northeasterly direction.
In both views the Hell Gate Bridge is dimly seen on the horizon.
The body and tower of the building have been completed.
In the right center background is the R.C.A. tower on the west side of Lexington Avenue between 50th and 51st Streets.
The Queensboro Bridge may be seen between these buildings.
July 11, 1931.

P.L. Sperr, Photographer.

(2)

The same, a slightly closer view, not showing the R.C.A. tower and showing on the left, the tower of the 42-story Inter-national Mart, on the N.E. corner of Madison Avenue and 53rd Street, nearing completion.

July 11, 1931.

P.L. Sperr, Photographer.

49th Street, north side, west from Madison Avenue.
April 4, 1932.

P. L. Sperr.

folder: 49th Street and Madison Avenue, Manhattan, N.Y.
text:
(1) The New York City Fire Department "Holy Name Society"; marching west along 49th Street, at Madison Ave., enroute to St. Patrick's Cathedral for a Sunday High Mass.

About 1935?


(2) The same scene, from a slightly different angle; looking east along 49th Street, from Madison Ave.

About 1935?


(3) The same scene, looking west along 49th Street, from Madison Ave. The cortege is seen turning north at Fifth Ave.

About 1935?
title: Celebrations - Parades - Municipal events - Firemen.

text:
Madison Ave., south from, and including East 49th Street. The 5-story corner house, on the left, is No. 34 East 49th Street.

March 12, 1937.

P. L. Sperr.
